body_html:
One guess was that, for a given feed/fetch combination, images = tf.random_uniform([size, size]) is a constant, and so constant folding could make a constant out of it.

Constant folding in common_runtime only makes a constant if it's <10MB, while that tensor is 144MB.

However, constant folding in grappler may not apply this limit - at least, I couldn't find it looking over just now (core/grappler/optimizers/constant_folding.cc).
body_text:
One guess was that, for a given feed/fetch combination,   images = tf.random_uniform([size, size])   is a constant, and so constant folding could make a constant out of it.
Constant folding in common_runtime only makes a constant if it's <10MB, while that tensor is 144MB.
However, constant folding in grappler may not apply this limit - at least, I couldn't find it looking over just now (core/grappler/optimizers/constant_folding.cc).
body:
One guess was that, for a given feed/fetch combination,   images = tf.random_uniform([size, size])   is a constant, and so constant folding could make a constant out of it.

Constant folding in common_runtime only makes a constant if it's <10MB, while that tensor is 144MB.

However, constant folding in grappler may not apply this limit - at least, I couldn't find it looking over just now (core/grappler/optimizers/constant_folding.cc).
